prompt: <description>Part 1: Cylindrical Object Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom and a slightly tapered middle section. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. 3. Create a circle centered at [0.375, 0.375] with a radius of 0.375. This forms the top face of the cylindrical object (face_1, loop_1). 4. Create another circle concentric with the first, but with a radius of 0.3708 (face_1, loop_2). 5. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 6. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the coordinate system defined above. 7. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.15 units along the Z-axis. Part 2: Rectangular Prism Create a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. This part will be used to cut out a rectangular hole in the center of the final shape. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector of [0.375, 0.375, 0.0]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. 3. Create a rectangle with vertices at [0.0, 0.0], [0.42, 0.0], [0.42, 0.105], and [0.0, 0.105] (face_1, loop_1). 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.42. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the coordinate system defined above. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.1875 units along the Z-axis, both towards the normal and the opposite direction. These instructions, when followed, will generate the CAD model of a ring with a rectangular hole in the center, as described in the given JSON data.</description>
